Pre-Game Insights: France will look to recover from Saturday's defeat to Germany when they welcome Chile to the Stade Velodrome on Tuesday.
Chile will represent a good challenge for the French too, in a first meeting between the nations since a 1-1 draw in 2011.
France possible starting lineup: Maignan; Clauss, Saliba, Konate, T Hernandez; Zaire-Emery, Tchouameni, Camavinga; Kolo Muani, Giroud, Mbappe
Chile possible starting lineup: Bravo; Isla, Diaz, Lichnovsky, Suazo; Echeverria, Nunez; Osorio, Alexis, Davila; Vargas
Post-Match Reflections: France will be fully expectant of a win to make up for Saturday's defeat, even though Chile appear to be a side improving under new management.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Antoine Griezmann was a late casualty from the squad after the Atletico Madrid forward picked up a recurrence of a previous injury, ending his incredible 84-game streak in the France side.
Alexis Sanchez will become the all-time record cap holder for the Chile national team if he appears in this encounter, taking him onto 162, above Gary Medel, whose record he matched on Friday.
Others: The two also met at the very first World Cup back in 1930
